meanings.definition: A specified portion or share of something that is required or expected
meanings.sent1: Each team member must contribute their quotum of work to complete the project.
meanings.sent2: The company's quotum of profits for the year was higher than expected.
meanings.sent3: The birthday cake was divided into equal quotums for all the party guests.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a quotum of light in the darkness of the world.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked each student to write their quotum of sentences for homework.

meanings.definition: The minimum number of votes required for a decision to be valid
meanings.sent1: The board members needed to reach the quotum to pass the new policy.
meanings.sent2: The student council had to meet the quotum to elect the new president.
meanings.sent3: The cats in the neighborhood held a meeting to decide on the quotum of treats to ask for.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, reaching the quotum needed to lift everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The team needed to gather the quotum of signatures to petition for change.
